text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
MATERIAL CHANGES
As of the publication of this manual, TE/GE is undergoing a restructure which will affect titles, authorities, and offices.
(cid:
) All references to The Examination Program and Review (EPR) and the authorities granted to manager of that office will be changed, pending announcement for the authorized replacement. (cid:
) All references to Case Selection and Delivery (CS&D) are changed to CP&C Classiﬁcation and CP&C Case Assignment. (cid:
) All references to Examination Special Support (ESS) are changed to “EO Closing Unit,” EGC
(cid:
) All references to “EO Classiﬁcation-Referrals” are changed to “EO Referrals Group.”
sections were written to comply with the Plain Writing Act. For additional information on the Plain Act, see http://www.plainlanguage.gov.
Added IRM 4.75.28.1, Program Scope and Objectives.

Incorporated contents of the November 19, 2015, Memorandum from the Deputy Commissioner for Services and Enforcement, entitled Revision of Policy for Use of Fax in Taxpayer Submissions to IRM 4.75.28.4.4 and IRM 4.75.28.6.2.
Added “Establishing Form 1040 in RCCMS” in IRM 4.75.28.4.2.1.
Added “Establishing Form 1120 in RCCMS ”in IRM

) Discrepancy adjustments fall within the scope of Rev. Proc.

Agents should consult the K-Net Knowledge Management Network to ensure proper issue development and consistent application of the law.

) Due to the fact SB/SE will not accept referrals under a certain dollar examiners are encouraged to make discrepancy adjustments whenever possible. (
) Alternatives to making a discrepancy adjustment include: a. Soliciting and securing amended tax returns b. Making a referral to the appropriate operating division on Form
, TE/GE Referral Information Report c. A combination of (a) and (b) d. Requesting a collateral examination (

An AMDISA print will show the Employee Group Code (EGC) for the agent assigned to the case. Find the EGC contact information at AIMS/ERC
It can take up to

days for an audited income tax return to drop off AIMS after another operating division closes it. You can’t establish the return on EO AIMS as a discrepancy adjustment until this happens. For this reason, consider securing an amended return, if the return has been previously audited. See IRM
, EO Delinquent, Amended and Substitute for Re- turn Procedures.

You can use a RTVUE or BRTVU print as the equivalent of a tax return if it provides sufficient line item detail of the Form 1040 or 1120. You must however carefully review IDRS transcripts to determine if the return was adjusted after the TC 150 posting.

) Prepare Form

-E as the basic report form for discrepancy adjustments. Include the following comments in the “Other Information” section on page a. “This discrepancy adjustment does not constitute an examination of tax return.” b. “See the attached Form
-A for an explanation of the issues.” c. “IRC
(g) does not apply” or “IRC
(g) does apply” See IRM
for speciﬁc notations. (
) Use Form

-A for your write-up of the issues. Organize the report as a. Issue – Clearly state the issues. b. Facts–Provide pertinent details surrounding the issue. c. Law– Provide a summary of Code sections, Revenue Rulings, court cases, etc., that relate to the issue(s) raised. d. Government’s Position– Discuss each issue separately and apply the and the facts relevant to each speciﬁc issue. List a summary of taxes and the applicability of penalties. e. Taxpayer’s Position– State the taxpayer’s position including any the taxpayer has made on the Government’s position. If the taxpayer hasn’t provided a position on the Issue(s), a simple statement to that is sufficient. f. Conclusion– Restate the Government’s position as a conclusion. If the taxpayer provides a position on the issue(s), list the Government’s to it. (
) Address penalties and interest in both the work papers and the Form
-A. See IRM
and IRM

) Mail the discrepancy adjustment package to the taxpayer by Certiﬁed Mail the “last known address”. a. Get an INOLES print to obtain the taxpayer’s last known address. b. Use a subsequent address if other sources conﬁrm that the taxpayer’s address has changed from the one on INOLES. Note: If you’re unsure of the validity of the subsequent address, send certiﬁed letter to both addresses.
Prepare Form 4549-E as the basic report form for discrepancy adjustments. Include the following comments in the “Other Information” section on page two:

Issue – Clearly state the issues. Facts–Provide pertinent details surrounding the issue. Law– Provide a summary of Code sections, Revenue Rulings, court cases, etc., that relate to the issue(s) raised. Government’s Position– Discuss each issue separately and apply the and the facts relevant to each speciﬁc issue. List a summary of taxes and the applicability of penalties. Taxpayer’s Position– State the taxpayer’s position including any the taxpayer has made on the Government’s position. If the taxpayer hasn’t provided a position on the Issue(s), a simple statement to that is sufficient. Conclusion– Restate the Government’s position as a conclusion. If the taxpayer provides a position on the issue(s), list the Government’s to it.

ment: a. Get your manager’s approval on the CCR for the appropriate penalties before you mail the discrepancy adjustment package to the taxpayer. b. Notify the taxpayer in writing that penalties are being assessed. Provide the penalty name, code section and a computation of the penalty.

) Every notice IRS sends to an individual that includes an amount of interest due must also include both, a: • Detailed computation of the interest charged. • Code section citation under which the interest is imposed. (

) If the IRS doesn’t provide a notice to the taxpayer who has timely ﬁled their tax return, speciﬁcally stating the taxpayer’s liability within a “speciﬁed period of time”, the IRS must suspend the interest. (See IRC
(g)). The “speciﬁed period of time” is
months for notices provided after November
(See (
CFR
) Suspension of interest under IRC
(g): a. Applies only to individuals, not to corporations. b. Applies only to timely ﬁled returns (returns ﬁled by the original due date or
c. Has an impact on discrepancy adjustments only with regard to the ment of interest. (
) IRC
(g) does not apply to: • Any penalty imposed by IRC
• Any case involving fraud • Most listed transactions • Any criminal penalty • Certain other situations noted in IRC
) For timely ﬁled Forms
covered by the
-month notiﬁcation deadline, interest will be suspended beginning on the day after the close of the

months after the later of (

Exempt Organizations Examination Procedures
) If innocent spouse relief is requested while the case is opened, you must include an addendum to your
-day letters to both spouses (and
day letters if necessary). The addendum should: a. Acknowledge receipt of the request for innocent spouse relief under

b. Inform the taxpayer that TE/GE Exempt Organizations does not make a determination of innocent spouse relief. c. Inform the taxpayer the determination of innocent spouse relief will be made by the appropriate IRS business unit after the discrepancy adjust- ment matter is concluded and the tax assessed. (
) Don’t solicit tax payments from the requesting spouse while a request for spousal relief is pending. You may however solicit tax payments from the requesting spouse. Refer the taxpayer to Pub
, Innocent Spouse Relief. (
) Check the “Innocent Spouse” block in the Mandatory Review section of
) If a taxpayer ﬁles a formal claim with a Campus Center on Form
, Claim Refund and Request for Rebate, Form
X, Amended U.S. Individual Income Tax Return, or Form
X, Amended U.S. Corporation Income Tax Return, while the income tax return is open on AIMS, the Campus Center send the claim to you. (

) Contact CP&C Classiﬁcation if you receive a claim from the Campus Center. You’ll either be given assistance in ruling on the claim or be instructed to transfer the claim to the appropriate operating division for audit. (
) If EO retains jurisdiction over the claim and the discrepancy adjustment is open, describe the disposition of the claim in the “Other Information” section Form
-E. See IRM
for guidance on statements to describe the disposition of claims. Caution: Don’t include the word “audit” when describing a claim’s disposition.
a. Acknowledge receipt of the request for innocent spouse relief under IRC

b. Inform the taxpayer that TE/GE Exempt Organizations does not make a determination of innocent spouse relief. c. ) If the claim is fully or partially allowed, enter the claim description and amount on the appropriate adjustment line of Form
) If a formal claim is fully or partially disallowed, include Form

) If agreement can be reached on one or more issues, encourage the to enter into a partial agreement by executing a Form
-E covering agreed issues. A typical situation might be where the taxpayer agrees to discrepancy adjustment; however, he does not agree to the penalty with the adjustment to his tax liability. (
) Partial agreement procedures aren’t appropriate if the taxpayer agrees to proposed adjustments in a speciﬁc tax period but doesn’t agree with adjustments in a prior or subsequent tax period. (
) For partial agreements, complete two separate Form
-E reports: a. Prepare one report showing only the agreed issues. Write “Partial Agreement” on top of the Form
-E. b. Prepare a second report that includes both the agreed and unagreed issues. (

Complete Form 5599, TE/GE Examined Closing Record, for all discrepancy adjustment cases. See the table for items which must be completed upon closing of the case.

Item Instruction P7 - 18 — TIN Insert the EIN or SSN for the Taxpayer. P21 - 22 — MFT Form 1040 = 30; Form 1120 = 02 P24 - 29 — Tax Period Insert the tax year being adjusted. P31 - 34 — Name Control Insert the ﬁrst four letters of the last name for Form 1040 or the ﬁrst four letters of the name for Form 1120. C — Name Insert taxpayer’s name (last name ﬁrst for Form 1040). 02 — Penalty Reason Code No entry unless penalties previously assessed are being abated. See IRM 4.5.2, for applicable codes. 08 — Agreement Date Insert the date the signed Form 4549-E is received. 12 — Tax Liability Insert Code “300” and the amount of the increase in tax as shown on line 14 of Form 4549-E, OR Insert Code “301” and the amount of decrease in tax that resulted from the discrepancy adjustment. 12 — Penalties Insert Code “320” for civil fraud penalty and amount of penalty. Insert Code “160” for the amount of any delinquency penalty to be assessed on late ﬁled returns. Note: Accuracy related penalties should be reﬂected on item 15. 12 — Interest Leave blank. Interest will be computed and input by the closing unit. 13 — Disposal Code 02 = No Change 03 = Agreed Tax Change 07 = Unagreed - Protest to Appeals 10 = Unagreed - Without Protest 13 = Referral to Other Operating Division 14 — Statute Extended to Insert current Statute of Limitations date if the statute has been extended. If the statute has not been extended, leave this item blank.
No entry unless penalties previously assessed are being abated. See IRM 4.5.2, for applicable codes.
Leave blank. Interest will be computed and input by the closing unit.

This is the amount from line 15 of Form 4549-E (i.e., additional withholding). 15 — Decrease in Adjustment Dollars Insert Code “765” if reducing an earned income credit. 28 — Examiner’s Time Time can be entered in whole hours and in tenths of hours. 30 — Technique Code Applicable codes: 1 = Office Interview Examination 2 = Office Correspondence Examination 4 = Field Examination 31 — Examiner’s Grade Enter applicable grade level. 32 — Case Grade Enter the grade of the case in the blocks from left to right as two digits Grade 9 = 09 Grade 11 = 11 Grade 12 = 12 Grade 13 = 13 33 — Examiner’s Name Last name, ﬁrst initial 40 — Project Code Use same project code as used for Form 990. 41a — No Change Issue Codes Enter “99999999” for 1040 with Disposal Code “02.” Otherwise, no entry is required. 42 — ARDI Code An entry is required only if the disposal code is “03” Leave blank if case is being closed“ No Change” or is “Unagreed”. Applicable Codes: 1— Fully Paid 2— Not Paid 3— Partially Paid 4— Installment Agreement with payment 5— Installment Agreement without payment 50 — Employee Group Code Enter your group number.

2 = Office Correspondence Examination 4 = Field Examination 31 — Examiner’s Grade Enter applicable grade level. 32 — Case Grade Enter the grade of the case in the blocks from left to right as two digits Grade 9 = 09 Grade 11 = 11 Grade 12 = 12 Grade 13 = 13 33 — Examiner’s Name Last name, ﬁrst initial 40 — Project Code Use same project code as used for Form 990. 41a — No Change Issue Codes Enter “99999999” for 1040 with Disposal Code “02.” Otherwise, no entry is required. 42 — ARDI Code An entry is required only if the disposal code is “03” Leave blank if case is being closed“ No Change” or is “Unagreed”. Applicable Codes: 1— Fully Paid 2— Not Paid 3— Partially Paid 4— Installment Agreement with payment 5— Installment Agreement without payment 50 — Employee Group Code Enter your group number. 701 — Principal Issue Code See Document 6379 for the appropriate code.
Internal Revenue Service
This following is suggested language to notify a taxpayer of our recommendation for audit con- sideration of their tax return.
Dear [insert salutation]:
you for your reply to our letter regarding the proposed tax adjustment to the tax return(s) and shown above.

Our proposed tax adjustment was not based on an audit, but on information already available to us. We have considered your reply to the proposed adjustments and are forwarding your case for audit consid-
If your return is selected for audit, we’ll notify you. No further action by you is necessary at this
If your return is selected for audit, we’ll notify you. No further action by you is necessary at this time. Thank you for your cooperation.
